Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effects of Unloader Knee Braces on Tibiofemoral Joint Loading

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to varus, valgus, or no brace conditions.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 20 healthy participants (mean age 28.3 years; BMI 22.9 kg/m²) with normal knee alignment.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to varus, valgus, or no brace conditions.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to investigate the effects of varus and valgus adjustments on knee joint loading and muscle activation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the knee adduction moment, measured during gait analysis.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 20 healthy participants

Result_Outcome.evidence: Effect sizes were moderate to large, indicating potential for future research.
